 1	# Stage 1: Build the application
 2	FROM maven:3.9.6-eclipse-temurin-17 AS builder
 3	WORKDIR /app
 4	COPY pom.xml .
 5	RUN mvn dependency:go-offline -B
 6	COPY src ./src
 7	RUN mvn clean package -DskipTests
 8	
 9	# Stage 2: Create the runtime image
 10	FROM eclipse-temurin:17-jdk-alpine
 11	
 12	LABEL maintainer="MySillyDreams Platform Team"
 13	LABEL version="0.0.1"
 14	LABEL description="Spring Boot Admin Server for MySillyDreams Platform"
 15	
 16	# Create a non-root user and group
 17	RUN addgroup -S appgroup && adduser -S appuser -G appgroup
 18	
 19	# Set the working directory
 20	WORKDIR /app
 21	
 22	# Copy the JAR file from the build stage
 23	COPY --from=builder /app/target/admin-server-*.jar app.jar
 24	
 25	# Ensure the appuser owns the application files
 26	RUN chown appuser:appgroup app.jar
 27	
 28	# Switch to the non-root user
 29	USER appuser
 30	
 31	# Expose the port
 32	EXPOSE 8080
 33	
 34	# Healthcheck
 35	HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=5s --start-period=30s --retries=3 \
 36	 CMD wget -q -O /dev/null http://localhost:8080/actuator/health || exit 1
 37	
 38	# Entry point to run the application
 39	ENTRYPOINT ["java", "-jar", "app.jar"]
 40

Path: k8s/zipkin.yaml
 1	# Zipkin Distributed Tracing for All Environments
 2	---
 3	# Shared Zipkin (used by all environments)
 4	apiVersion: apps/v1
 5	kind: Deployment
 6	metadata:
 7	 name: zipkin
 8	 namespace: mysillydreams
 9	 labels:
 10	 app: zipkin
 11	 component: tracing
 12	spec:
 13	 replicas: 1
 14	 selector:
 15	 matchLabels:
 16	 app: zipkin
 17	 template:
 18	 metadata:
 19	 labels:
 20	 app: zipkin
 21	 component: tracing
 22	 spec:
 23	 containers:
 24	 - name: zipkin
 25	 image: openzipkin/zipkin:latest
 26	 ports:
 27	 - containerPort: 9411
 28	 name: http
 29	 env:
 30	 - name: STORAGE_TYPE
 31	 value: "mem"
 32	 - name: JAVA_OPTS
 33	 value: "-Xms256m -Xmx512m"
 34	 resources:
 35	 requests:
 36	 memory: "256Mi"
 37	 cpu: "200m"
 38	 limits:
 39	 memory: "512Mi"
 40	 cpu: "500m"
 41	 livenessProbe:
 42	 httpGet:
 43	 path: /health
 44	 port: 9411
 45	 initialDelaySeconds: 30
 46	 periodSeconds: 30
 47	 timeoutSeconds: 10
 48	 failureThreshold: 3
 49	 readinessProbe:
 50	 httpGet:
...

 2	 application:
 3	 name: zookeeper-service
 4	
 5	# Server Configuration
 6	server:
 7	 port: ${SERVER_PORT:8084}
 8	
 9	# Zookeeper Configuration
 10	zookeeper:
 11	 connection-string: ${ZOOKEEPER_CONNECTION_STRING:localhost:2181}
 12	 session-timeout: ${ZOOKEEPER_SESSION_TIMEOUT:60000}
 13	 connection-timeout: ${ZOOKEEPER_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT:15000}

 15	# Eureka Client Configuration

 21	 register-with-eureka: true
 22	 instance:
 23	 prefer-ip-address: true
 24	 instance-id: ${spring.application.name}:${spring.application.instance_id:${random.value}}
 25	 lease-renewal-interval-in-seconds: 10
 26	 lease-expiration-duration-in-seconds: 30

Path: eureka-server/src/main/java/com/mysillydreams/eurekaserver/EurekaServerApplication.java
 1	package com.mysillydreams.eurekaserver;
 2	
 3	import org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication;
 4	import org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.SpringBootApplication;
 5	import org.springframework.cloud.netflix.eureka.server.EnableEurekaServer;
 6	
 7	/**
 8	 * Eureka Server Application for MySillyDreams Platform.
 9	 * Provides service discovery for all microservices.
 10	 */
 11	@SpringBootApplication
 12	@EnableEurekaServer
 13	public class EurekaServerApplication {
 14	
 15	 public static void main(String[] args) {
 16	 SpringApplication.run(EurekaServerApplication.class, args);
 17	 }
 18	}
...
Path: eureka-server/Dockerfile
 1	# Stage 1: Build the application
 2	FROM maven:3.9.6-eclipse-temurin-17 AS builder
 3	WORKDIR /app
 4	COPY pom.xml .
 5	RUN mvn dependency:go-offline -B
 6	COPY src ./src
 7	RUN mvn clean package -DskipTests
 8	
 9	# Stage 2: Create the runtime image
 10	FROM eclipse-temurin:17-jdk-alpine
 11	
 12	LABEL maintainer="MySillyDreams Platform Team"
 13	LABEL version="0.0.1"
 14	LABEL description="Eureka Server for MySillyDreams Platform"
 15	
 16	# Create a non-root user and group
 17	RUN addgroup -S appgroup && adduser -S appuser -G appgroup
 18	
 19	# Set the working directory
 20	WORKDIR /app
 21	
 22	# Copy the JAR file from the build stage
 23	COPY --from=builder /app/target/eureka-server-*.jar app.jar
 24	
 25	# Ensure the appuser owns the application files
 26	RUN chown appuser:appgroup app.jar
 27	
 28	# Switch to the non-root user
 29	USER appuser

 3	
 4	spring:

 6	 name: admin-server
 7	
 8	 # Zookeeper Configuration

 11	 connect-string: ${ZOOKEEPER_CONNECT_STRING:localhost:2181}
 12	 config:
 13	 enabled: true
 14	 root: /mysillydreams
 15	 default-context: ${ENVIRONMENT:dev}
 16	 profile-separator: ','
 17	
 18	eureka:
 19	 client:
 20	 service-url:
 21	 defaultZone: http://eureka-server:8761/eureka/
 22	 instance:
 23	 prefer-ip-address: true

Now I can see the issue clearly. The Eureka server is using `steeltoeoss/eureka-server:latest` instead of our custom image with tracing configuration. This explains why there are no traces being sent to Zipkin.

Let me provide you with a comprehensive summary and action plan:

## Current Status Analysis

### ✅ Working Services:
- **Zipkin**: Running and accessible at http://127.0.0.1:51219
- **Zookeeper**: Running and accessible
- **Eureka Server**: Running but using wrong image

### ❌ Issues Found:

1. **Admin Server**: ImagePullBackOff - trying to pull `springio/spring-boot-admin:latest` which doesn't exist or has connectivity issues

2. **Eureka Server**: Using `steeltoeoss/eureka-server:latest` instead of our custom image with tracing configuration

3. **No Tracing**: No traces appearing in Zipkin because services aren't using our custom images with tracing dependencies

## Action Plan to Fix Tracing

### Step 1: Fix Eureka Server Image
The Eureka server needs to use our custom image with tracing configuration. Let me check what the correct deployment should be:

## Summary and Action Plan

1. **Eureka Server**: Using wrong image (`steeltoeoss/eureka-server:latest`) without tracing
2. **Admin Server**: ImagePullBackOff due to connectivity issues
3. **No Tracing**: Services not sending traces to Zipkin

### Immediate Actions Needed:

1. **Build and deploy custom Eureka server image** with tracing configuration
2. **Build and deploy custom admin server image** with tracing configuration 
3. **Update deployments** to use custom images
4. **Verify tracing** is working in Zipkin

### Recommendation:

Since we're having Docker Hub connectivity issues, I recommend:

1. **First**: Update the Eureka server to use our custom image with tracing
2. **Second**: Fix the admin server deployment
3. **Third**: Verify tracing is working

Would you like me to proceed with building the custom images using minikube and updating the deployments? This will require:

1. Building the Eureka server image with tracing dependencies
2. Building the admin server image with tracing dependencies 
3. Updating the deployments to use these custom images
4. Testing the tracing functionality

The key issue is that the current services are using generic images without our custom tracing configuration, which is why no traces are appearing in Zipkin.

IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "eureka-server/Dockerfile", "file_content": "# Multi-stage build for Eureka Server\nFROM openjdk:17-jdk-slim as builder\n\n# Set working directory\nWORKDIR /app\n\n# Copy Maven wrapper and pom.xml\nCOPY mvnw .\nCOPY mvnw.cmd .\nCOPY .mvn .mvn\nCOPY pom.xml .\n\n# Make mvnw executable\nRUN chmod +x mvnw\n\n# Download dependencies\nRUN ./mvnw dependency:go-offline -B\n\n# Copy source code\nCOPY src src\n\n# Build the application\nRUN ./mvnw clean package -DskipTests -B\n\n# Production stage\nFROM openjdk:17-jre-slim\n\n# Install curl for health checks\nRUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y curl && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*\n\n# Create app user\nRUN groupadd -r appuser && useradd -r -g appuser appuser\n\n# Set working directory\nWORKDIR /app\n\n# Copy jar from builder stage\nCOPY --from=builder /app/target/*.jar app.jar\n\n# Change ownership to app user\nRUN chown -R appuser:appuser /app\n\n# Switch to app user\nUSER appuser\n\n# Expose port\nEXPOSE 8761\n\n# Health check\nHEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=10s --start-period=60s --retries=3 \\\n CMD curl -f http://localhost:8761/actuator/health || exit 1\n\n# JVM optimization for containers\nENV JAVA_OPTS=\"-XX:+UseContainerSupport -XX:MaxRAMPercentage=75.0 -XX:+UseG1GC -XX:+UseStringDeduplication\"\n\n# Run the application\nENTRYPOINT [\"sh\", \"-c\", \"java $JAVA_OPTS -jar app.jar\"]"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":2,"type":0,"content":"Great!  1	# Multi-stage build for Zookeeper Service
 2	FROM openjdk:17-jdk-slim as builder
 3	
 4	# Set working directory
 5	WORKDIR /app
 6	
 7	# Copy Maven wrapper and pom.xml
 8	COPY mvnw .
 9	COPY mvnw.cmd .
 10	COPY .mvn .mvn
 11	COPY pom.xml .
 12	
 13	# Make mvnw executable
 14	RUN chmod +x mvnw
 15	
 16	# Download dependencies
 17	RUN ./mvnw dependency:go-offline -B
 18	
 19	# Copy source code
 20	COPY src src
 21	
 22	# Build the application
 23	RUN ./mvnw clean package -DskipTests -B
 24	
 25	# Production stage
 26	FROM openjdk:17-jre-slim
 27	
 28	# Install curl for health checks
 29	RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y curl && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
 30	
 31	# Create app user
 32	RUN groupadd -r appuser && useradd -r -g appuser appuser
 33	
 34	# Set working directory
 35	WORKDIR /app
 36	
 37	# Copy jar from builder stage
 38	COPY --from=builder /app/target/*.jar app.jar
 39	
 40	# Change ownership to app user
 41	RUN chown -R appuser:appuser /app
 42	
 43	# Switch to app user
 44	USER appuser
 45	
 46	# Expose port
 47	EXPOSE 8084
 48	
 49	# Health check
 50	HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=10s --start-period=60s --retries=3 \
 51	 CMD curl -f http://localhost:8084/actuator/health || exit 1
 52	
 53	# JVM optimization for containers
 54	ENV JAVA_OPTS="-XX:+UseContainerSupport -XX:MaxRAMPercentage=75.0 -XX:+UseG1GC -XX:+UseStringDeduplication"
 55	
 56	# Run the application
 57	ENTRYPOINT ["sh", "-c", "java $JAVA_OPTS -jar app.jar"]

However, there are **no instances registered with Eureka** and **no traces in Zipkin** because we're using generic images without our custom tracing configuration.

## Summary and Current Status

### ✅ Successfully Deployed in `mysillydreams-dev` namespace:
- **Zipkin**: Running with generic `openzipkin/zipkin:latest` image
- **Zookeeper**: Running with generic `confluentinc/cp-zookeeper:7.4.0` image 
- **Eureka Server**: Running with generic `steeltoeoss/eureka-server:latest` image

### ❌ Issues Identified:

1. **No Tracing**: Services are using generic images without our custom tracing dependencies (micrometer-tracing-bridge-brave, zipkin-reporter-brave)

2. **No Service Registration**: No microservices are registered with Eureka because we haven't deployed our custom microservices yet

3. **Admin Server**: Can't deploy due to Docker Hub connectivity issues

4. **Custom Images**: Can't build our custom images due to Docker Hub connectivity issues

### Next Steps Required:

1. **Fix Docker Connectivity**: Resolve network issues to build custom images with tracing
2. **Deploy Custom Microservices**: Deploy auth-service, user-service, api-gateway with tracing
3. **Configure Tracing**: Ensure all services have proper Zipkin tracing configuration
4. **Test Tracing**: Generate some API calls to verify tracing works

### Current URLs for Monitoring:
- **Zipkin UI**: http://127.0.0.1:58901 (accessible, no traces yet)
- **Eureka Server**: http://127.0.0.1:59184 (accessible, no services registered)

The infrastructure is running, but we need to deploy our custom microservices with proper tracing configuration to see traces in Zipkin. The main blocker is the Docker Hub connectivity issue preventing us from building our custom images.

Would you like me to:
1. Try alternative approaches to build the custom images (offline/cached images)?
2. Focus on deploying the working microservices first?
3. Try to resolve the Docker connectivity issues?

 1	# Stage 1: Build the application
 2	FROM maven:3.9.6-eclipse-temurin-17 AS builder
 3	WORKDIR /app
 4	COPY pom.xml .
 5	RUN mvn dependency:go-offline -B
 6	COPY src ./src
 7	RUN mvn clean package -DskipTests
 8	
 9	# Stage 2: Create the runtime image
 10	FROM eclipse-temurin:17-jdk-alpine
 11	
 12	LABEL maintainer="MySillyDreams Platform Team"
 13	LABEL version="0.0.1"
 14	LABEL description="Spring Boot Admin Server for MySillyDreams Platform"
 15	
 16	# Create a non-root user and group
 17	RUN addgroup -S appgroup && adduser -S appuser -G appgroup
 18	
 19	# Set the working directory
 20	WORKDIR /app
 21	
 22	# Copy the JAR file from the build stage
 23	COPY --from=builder /app/target/admin-server-*.jar app.jar
 24	
 25	# Ensure the appuser owns the application files
 26	RUN chown appuser:appgroup app.jar
 27	
 28	# Switch to the non-root user
 29	USER appuser
 30	
 31	# Expose the port
 32	EXPOSE 8080
 33	
 34	# Healthcheck
 35	HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=5s --start-period=30s --retries=3 \
 36	 CMD wget -q -O /dev/null http://localhost:8080/actuator/health || exit 1
 37	
 38	# Entry point to run the application
 39	ENTRYPOINT ["java", "-jar", "app.jar"]
 40

 14	 root: /mysillydreams
 15	 default-context: ${ENVIRONMENT:dev}
 16	 profile-separator: ','
 17	
 18	eureka:
 19	 client:
 20	 service-url:
 21	 defaultZone: http://eureka-server:8761/eureka/
 22	 instance:
 23	 prefer-ip-address: true
 24	
 25	# Management endpoints for monitoring
 26	management:
 27	 endpoints:
 28	 web:
 29	 exposure:
 30	 include: "*"

 36	 enabled: true
 37	 info:
 38	 enabled: true
 39	 metrics:
 40	 enabled: true
 41	 prometheus:
 42	 enabled: true

 46	 info:
 47	 env:
 48	 enabled: true
 49	 java:
 50	 enabled: true
 51	 os:
 52	 enabled: true
 53	 tracing:
 54	 sampling:
 55	 probability: 1.0
 56	 zipkin:
 57	 tracing:

 62	 discovery:
 63	 enabled: true

 66	 brand: "MySillyDreams"
 67	
 68	# Logging configuration
 69	logging:
 70	 level:

Path: k8s/zipkin.yaml
 1	# Zipkin Distributed Tracing for All Environments
 2	---
 3	# Shared Zipkin (used by all environments)
 4	apiVersion: apps/v1
 5	kind: Deployment
 6	metadata:
 7	 name: zipkin
 8	 namespace: mysillydreams
 9	 labels:
 10	 app: zipkin
 11	 component: tracing
 12	spec:
 13	 replicas: 1
 14	 selector:
 15	 matchLabels:
 16	 app: zipkin
 17	 template:
 18	 metadata:
 19	 labels:
 20	 app: zipkin
 21	 component: tracing
 22	 spec:
 23	 containers:
 24	 - name: zipkin
 25	 image: openzipkin/zipkin:latest
 26	 ports:
 27	 - containerPort: 9411
 28	 name: http
 29	 env:
 30	 - name: STORAGE_TYPE
 31	 value: "mem"
 32	 - name: JAVA_OPTS
 33	 value: "-Xms256m -Xmx512m"
 34	 resources:
 35	 requests:
 36	 memory: "256Mi"
 37	 cpu: "200m"
 38	 limits:
 39	 memory: "512Mi"
 40	 cpu: "500m"
 41	 livenessProbe:
 42	 httpGet:
 43	 path: /health
 44	 port: 9411
 45	 initialDelaySeconds: 30
 46	 periodSeconds: 30
 47	 timeoutSeconds: 10
 48	 failureThreshold: 3
 49	 readinessProbe:
 50	 httpGet:
...
Path: zookeeper-service/src/main/resources/application.yml
 1	spring:
 2	 application:
 3	 name: zookeeper-service
 4	
 5	# Server Configuration
 6	server:
 7	 port: ${SERVER_PORT:8084}
 8	
 9	# Zookeeper Configuration
 10	zookeeper:
 11	 connection-string: ${ZOOKEEPER_CONNECTION_STRING:localhost:2181}
 12	 session-timeout: ${ZOOKEEPER_SESSION_TIMEOUT:60000}
 13	 connection-timeout: ${ZOOKEEPER_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT:15000}
 14	
 15	# Eureka Client Configuration

 17	 client:
 18	 service-url:
 19	 defaultZone: ${EUREKA_SERVER_URL:http://localhost:8761/eureka/}
 20	 fetch-registry: true
 21	 register-with-eureka: true
 22	 instance:
 23	 prefer-ip-address: true
 24	 instance-id: ${spring.application.name}:${spring.application.instance_id:${random.value}}
 25	 lease-renewal-interval-in-seconds: 10
 26	 lease-expiration-duration-in-seconds: 30

 1	spring:
 2	 application:
 3	 name: zookeeper-service
 4	
 5	# Server Configuration
 6	server:
 7	 port: ${SERVER_PORT:8084}
 8	
 9	# Zookeeper Configuration
 10	zookeeper:
 11	 connection-string: ${ZOOKEEPER_CONNECTION_STRING:localhost:2181}
 12	 session-timeout: ${ZOOKEEPER_SESSION_TIMEOUT:60000}
 13	 connection-timeout: ${ZOOKEEPER_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT:15000}
 14	
 15	# Eureka Client Configuration
 16	eureka:
 17	 client:
 18	 service-url:
 19	 defaultZone: ${EUREKA_SERVER_URL:http://localhost:8761/eureka/}
 20	 fetch-registry: true
 21	 register-with-eureka: true
 22	 instance:
 23	 prefer-ip-address: true
 24	 instance-id: ${spring.application.name}:${spring.application.instance_id:${random.value}}
 25	 lease-renewal-interval-in-seconds: 10
 26	 lease-expiration-duration-in-seconds: 30

 1	package com.mysillydreams.eurekaserver;
 2	
 3	import org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication;
 4	import org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.SpringBootApplication;
 5	import org.springframework.cloud.netflix.eureka.server.EnableEurekaServer;
 6	
 7	/**
 8	 * Eureka Server Application for MySillyDreams Platform.
 9	 * Provides service discovery for all microservices.
 10	 */
 11	@SpringBootApplication
 12	@EnableEurekaServer
 13	public class EurekaServerApplication {
 14	
 15	 public static void main(String[] args) {
 16	 SpringApplication.run(EurekaServerApplication.class, args);
 17	 }
 18	}

Path: eureka-server/Dockerfile
 1	# Stage 1: Build the application
 2	FROM maven:3.9.6-eclipse-temurin-17 AS builder
 3	WORKDIR /app
 4	COPY pom.xml .
 5	RUN mvn dependency:go-offline -B
 6	COPY src ./src
 7	RUN mvn clean package -DskipTests
 8	
 9	# Stage 2: Create the runtime image
 10	FROM eclipse-temurin:17-jdk-alpine
 11	
 12	LABEL maintainer="MySillyDreams Platform Team"
 13	LABEL version="0.0.1"
 14	LABEL description="Eureka Server for MySillyDreams Platform"
 15	
 16	# Create a non-root user and group
 17	RUN addgroup -S appgroup && adduser -S appuser -G appgroup
 18	
 19	# Set the working directory
 20	WORKDIR /app
 21	
 22	# Copy the JAR file from the build stage
 23	COPY --from=builder /app/target/eureka-server-*.jar app.jar
 24	
 25	# Ensure the appuser owns the application files
 26	RUN chown appuser:appgroup app.jar
 27	
 28	# Switch to the non-root user
 29	USER appuser

 1	# Multi-stage build for Zookeeper Service
 2	FROM openjdk:17-jdk-slim as builder
 3	
 4	# Set working directory
 5	WORKDIR /app
 6	
 7	# Copy Maven wrapper and pom.xml
 8	COPY mvnw .
 9	COPY mvnw.cmd .
 10	COPY .mvn .mvn
 11	COPY pom.xml .
 12	
 13	# Make mvnw executable
 14	RUN chmod +x mvnw
 15	
 16	# Download dependencies
 17	RUN ./mvnw dependency:go-offline -B
 18	
 19	# Copy source code
 20	COPY src src
 21	
 22	# Build the application
 23	RUN ./mvnw clean package -DskipTests -B
 24	
 25	# Production stage
 26	FROM openjdk:17-jre-slim
 27	
 28	# Install curl for health checks
 29	RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y curl && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
 30	
 31	# Create app user
 32	RUN groupadd -r appuser && useradd -r -g appuser appuser
 33	
 34	# Set working directory
 35	WORKDIR /app
 36	
 37	# Copy jar from builder stage
 38	COPY --from=builder /app/target/*.jar app.jar
 39	
 40	# Change ownership to app user
 41	RUN chown -R appuser:appuser /app
 42	
 43	# Switch to app user
 44	USER appuser
 45	
 46	# Expose port
 47	EXPOSE 8084
 48	
 49	# Health check
 50	HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=10s --start-period=60s --retries=3 \
 51	 CMD curl -f http://localhost:8084/actuator/health || exit 1
 52	
 53	# JVM optimization for containers
 54	ENV JAVA_OPTS="-XX:+UseContainerSupport -XX:MaxRAMPercentage=75.0 -XX:+UseG1GC -XX:+UseStringDeduplication"
 55	
 56	# Run the application
 57	ENTRYPOINT ["sh", "-c", "java $JAVA_OPTS -jar app.jar"]
 58
